p: Taro mucilage, mainly composed of neutral sugar, absorbs mutagenic/carcinogenic agents and also takes part in anti-hyperglycemic and anti-hyperlipidemic effects. A mucilage-rich extract from crude taro flour inhibits the starch-hydrolytic enzymes α-glucosidase and α-amylase, and pancreatic lipase. [ 56, 131]. Arabinogalactan extracted from taro flour mucilage and incorporated into hypercaloric rat diets decreased lipid levels in serum and tissues, and it reduced hepatocyte synthesis/secretion of apoB-containing lipoproteins, mainly VLDL [ 60]. The viscous mucilage fibers are known to reduce the bolus motility through the gastrointestinal tract and, as a consequence, the increasing digestion and absorption of macronutrients, especially lipids and carbohydrates, promoting satiety [ 132]. Glucose entrapment by plant mucilage is a widely described phenomenon [ 133, 134, 135].
